question: Some people say that physical exercise should be a required part of every school day. Others believe that students should spend their whole day on academic studies. Discuss both the views and state your opinion?
text: The significance of exercises as part of the school curriculum has been a debatable issue. Some folks argue that school students should enrol in physical exercises while others say that they should focus on their grades. This essay will delve into both these arguments before reaching an opinion.

To begin with, sports activities at a young age can have many long term benefits like height, weight and good body shape. This has been a noticeable fact that the children involved in games have good physical health and are more confident. Moreover, participation in games can boost their memory and concentration. Therefore, this will automatically enhance their academic performance.Further, sporting also teaches team values and punctuality. Additionally, there is a good career opportunity in athletics these days. For instance, famous cricketers like MS Dhoni is among the most famous men.

On the other hand, a group of people say that kids should give their 100% to academics so that they can have a good job in future. Academic excellence is required for a lucrative job. For example, a person should have good marks in order to have a white colour job like doctor, teacher or engineer. Researchers state that students not getting enough time for their studies and have so much mental stress.

In the conclusion, Although studies are important, sports should not be overlooked. In my opinion, Physical activities are very essential to avoid health issues, improve mental strength. It builds a good personality by embedding leadership, team spirit and honesty.
